title: Gower Day Trip from Cardiff
tagline: Beach adventure an hour from the city
suitableFor: Families, couples, and solo travelers looking for a relaxed coastal experience with some light activity. Good for beginners to surfing and walking.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking extreme sports or demanding hikes. People with limited mobility may find some areas challenging.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson at Llangennith Beach
stops.description: Learn to surf with Llangennith Surf School on one of Gower's best surfing beaches. Expect a fun and informative session with qualified instructors.

wetAlt.title: Indoor Climbing at Swansea
wetAlt.description: Head to an indoor climbing centre in Swansea for a climbing session.

budgetAlt.title: Relaxing on Llangennith Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the beach. Build sandcastles, paddle in the sea, or simply relax.

stops.title: The King's Head, Llangennith
stops.description: Traditional pub serving hearty meals with views of the beach, perfect after a surfing lesson.
stops.travelToNext: 30min drive via B4247 and minor roads

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Rhossili Bay viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own packed lunch with stunning views of Worm's Head at Rhossili Bay.

stops.title: Rhossili Bay Coastal Walk & Worm's Head
stops.description: Walk along the iconic Rhossili Bay beach and, if the tide is right, venture out to Worm's Head. Check tide times before you go!
stops.travelToNext: 1 hour 15min drive via A4118 to Cardiff

wetAlt.title: National Waterfront Museum, Swansea
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of Welsh industry and innovation at this free museum in Swansea.

budgetAlt.title: Rhossili Bay Coastal Walk & Worm's Head
budgetAlt.description: Walk along the iconic Rhossili Bay beach and, if the tide is right, venture out to Worm's Head. Check tide times before you go!

stops.title: Drive back to Cardiff

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Gower weather can change quickly. Check the forecast before you go and be prepared for rain, even in summer. Sea fog is common and can reduce visibility.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on the M4 and A4118, especially during peak season and bank holidays. Allow extra time for travel. Parking at Rhossili can fill up quickly, especially at weekends. Arrive early or use the park-and-ride service.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Surfing lessons should be booked in advance, especially during peak season. Check tide times before walking to Worm's Head, as access is only possible at low tide.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary involves light walking and surfing. A reasonable level of fitness is required. The walk to Worm's Head can be challenging in places.
